com.rti.dds.example.util
Class ProgramOptions.Option

java.lang.Object
  com.rti.dds.example.util.ProgramOptions.Option
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
Enclosing class:
ProgramOptions
public static class ProgramOptions.Option
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

This class represents a particular option available to a program.

Field Detail

name

private final java.lang.String name
String used to identify the argument associated with this Option.

type

private final java.lang.Class type
The type of this Option's value.

isBool

private final boolean isBool
True iff this Option is a boolean option. Boolean options have their default values toggled when present in argument list.

value

private java.lang.String value
Stores the value of the Option. Initialized to the default value if one is given. A null devault value implies the Option is required.

isRequired

private final boolean isRequired
Tracks whether or not the Option is required to be present.

found

private boolean found
Tracks whether this Option has been found while parsing arguments.

seq

final int seq
Sequence number indicating this Option's place within ProgramOptions. This allows Options to be printed in the order they were added, rather than e.g. alphabetically. This is often more sensible, as related options can be added contiguously.

Constructor Detail

ProgramOptions.Option

protected ProgramOptions.Option(ProgramOptions p,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String defaultValue,
                                java.lang.Class type,
                                boolean isBool)
Creates a new Boolean Option and adds it to p.

Parameters:
p - the ProgramOptions to which the Option will be added.
name - the name of the Option
defaultValue - the initial value of the Option, or null if it is required
type - the class that the value of this Option represents
isBool - true iff the Option is a boolean option

ProgramOptions.Option

protected ProgramOptions.Option(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String defaultValue,
                                java.lang.Class type,
                                boolean isBool)
This provides a way to create special options such as DEFAULT_HELP_OPTION. This constructor does not automatically add the Option to a ProgramOptions.

Parameters:
name - the name of the Option
defaultValue - the initial value of the Option, or null if it is required
type - the class that the value of this Option represents
isBool - true iff the Option is a boolean option

makeBooleanOption

public static ProgramOptions.Option makeBooleanOption(ProgramOptions p,
                                                      java.lang.String name,
                                                      boolean defaultValue)
Creates a new Boolean Option and adds it to p. If found as an argument, the Option will take its non-default value.

Parameters:
p - the ProgramOptions to which the Option will be added.
name - the name of the Option
defaultValue - the initial value of the Option, or null if it is required.
Returns:
a new Option

makeOption

public static ProgramOptions.Option makeOption(ProgramOptions p,
                                               java.lang.String name,
                                               java.lang.Class type,
                                               java.lang.String defaultValue)
Creates a new Option of arbitrary type and adds it to p. Use only when a more specific Option factory-constructor is not available.

Parameters:
p - the ProgramOptions to which the Option will be added.
name - the name of the Option
type - the class that the value of this Option represents
defaultValue - the initial value of the Option, or null if it is required.
Returns:
a new Option
